intro: Christella cylindrothrix, commonly known as the cylindrical thornvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and thorn-like structures. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Christella cylindrothrix is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments and can be found in forest understories.
